When the total number of deaths across the nuclear fuel cycle is calculated—including mining, plant operations, and accidents—it remains orders of magnitude lower than the death toll from coal.

Therefore, based on the available evidence and global data, it is well-established that coal power causes far more deaths per unit of energy than nuclear power.
